snippet: Google provided a first look at its Internet-connected glasses, which place a small see-through display screen above a person’s eye.
abstract: Google provides a first look at its Internet-connected glasses, which place a small see-through display screen above a person’s eye that can show maps and other data; firm is staking out a lead position in a futuristic and fast-growing area known as wearable computing.

headline.main: A Rose-Colored View May Come Standard
headline.print_headline: A Rose-Colored View May Come Standard

snippet: While Zillow offers assessed values of homes and Trulia provides searches based on a buyer’s needs, the new House Hunter app ranks the qualities of a home.
abstract: Bob Tedeschi App Smart column highlights smartphone apps for helping home buyers select the right house and make smarter bidding decisions.

headline.main: For Home Buyers, an App to Assess a House’s Attributes
headline.print_headline: For Home Buyers, an App to Assess a House’s Attributes

snippet: Readers react to two articles about plans to improve conditions at Apple’s factories in China.

headline.main: Working Conditions at Apple’s Overseas Factories

snippet: The sedan concept, first shown at the Tokyo Motor Show late last year, teases toward the Kodo-infused redesign of Mazda's midsize sedan.
abstract: The sedan concept, first shown at the Tokyo Motor Show late last year, teases toward the Kodo-infused redesign of Mazda's midsize sedan.

snippet: How should the U.S. update its currency? By going digital? Or replacing "In God We Trust"? Or redesigning bills so the blind can tell them apart?
abstract: How should the U.S. update its currency? By going digital? Or replacing "In God We Trust"? Or redesigning bills so the blind can tell them apart?

headline.main: Bringing Dollars and Cents Into This Century

snippet: In airports, laptop computers get special attention from the T.S.A. Similar devices don’t. The reasons are a mystery.

headline.main: The Mystery of the Flying Laptop
headline.print_headline: The Mystery of the Flying Laptop

snippet: "What's so special about JavaScript?" I asked the question to Brian Mitchell, the Director of Engineering at General Assembly, an entrepreneurial and educational hub for New York City's tech community. "It's the frontline. It's where the Internet ...
abstract: "What's so special about JavaScript?" I asked the question to Brian Mitchell, the Director of Engineering at General Assembly, an entrepreneurial and educational hub for New York City's tech community. "It's the frontline. It's where the Internet is evolving," he told me.

snippet: A consortium of publishers wants to offer a full buffet to readers, including big titles like The New Yorker and Time, for a single price.
abstract: A consortium of publishers wants to offer a full buffet to readers, including big titles like The New Yorker and Time, for a single price.

headline.main: Seeing a Future in Tablets, Magazines Unveil the Digital Newsstand

snippet: Rewarding manufacturers who increase their payroll in the United States may not be as effective as supporting the firms whose creations can conquer world markets — and pay for the jobs of the rest of us.
abstract: Eduardo Porter Economic Scene column on the seemingly promising upturn in American manufacturing suggests that it is innovation, not manufacturing, that has has always propelled American progress; calls for a jobs strategy that does not blunt the edge of competitive firms even if they outsource; concludes that a strategy to reward manufacturers who increase their payroll in the US may not be as effective as one to support the firms whose creations can conquer world markets.

headline.main: The Promise of Today’s Factory Jobs
headline.print_headline: The Promise Of Today’s Factory Jobs
